short_summary: Acquisition, a new TBIPS contract for delivery services. Proposed duration of this contract is for 1 year starting from March 6, 2023, to March 5, 2024, for services such as Informatics Professional Services.

full_summary:
**Title (English and French):** TBIPS - Multiple Resource Categories / SPICT - Plusieurs catégories de ressources

**Procurement Details**

*   **Solicitation Number:** 24062-23-037
*   **Reference Number:** PW-23-01022236
*   **Amendment Number:** 2
*   **Publication Date:** January 23, 2023
*   **Tender Closing Date:** February 21, 2023, 2:00 PM (Eastern Standard Time)
*   **Amendment Date:** February 15, 2023
*   **Contract Period:** March 6, 2023 – March 5, 2024

**Background**

The Treasury Board Secretariat of Canada requires additional resources to support the delivery and maintenance of existing and upcoming projects. The resources will be utilized to assist with the development and support of projects within the National Capital Region.

**Related Work**

Similar services have been performed by GCstrategies Inc. under contract No. 24062-19-488 from July 2019 to March 2023, with an estimated contract value of $1,998,970.00.

**Method of Supply**

This requirement is open to TBIPS Supply Arrangement Holders who have qualified under Tier 1 for services in the National Capital Region for the specified categories.

**Categories and Level**

*   (A.1) Application/Software Architect - Level 3
*   (A.6) Programmer/Software Developer - Level 3
*   (A.11) Tester - Level 3
*   (A.16) Web Multi-media Content Consultant - Level 3
*   (B.2) Business Architect - Level 3

**Security Clearances**

*   The Common PS SRCL #19 applies.
*   Minimum Corporate Security Required: Secret
*   Minimum Proposed Resources Security Required: Secret

**Contact Information**

For inquiries, please reach out to:

Robert Penwarden, Contracting Authority
Phone: 343-543-6021
Email: [Robert.Penwarden@tbs-sct.gc.ca](mailto:Robert.Penwarden@tbs-sct.gc.ca)

Documents will be provided to eligible bidders. Please note that the details of the restriction on the distribution of solicitation documents.

This requirement is subject to negotiation as part of a contract. Bidders are recommended to verify the details before making any submissions.  [
